00070 /* Utility Drawing Defines */
00071 
00072 /* determine the alpha value that should be used when 
00073  * drawing components for some F-Curve (fcu)
00074  *  - selected F-Curves should be more visible than partially visible ones
00075  */
00076 static float fcurve_display_alpha(FCurve *fcu)
00077 {
00078     return (fcu->flag & FCURVE_SELECTED) ? 1.0f : U.fcu_inactive_alpha;
00079 }

00084 /* Envelope -------------- */
00085 
00086 // TODO: draw a shaded poly showing the region of influence too!!!
00087 static void draw_fcurve_modifier_controls_envelope (FModifier *fcm, View2D *v2d)
00088 {
00089     FMod_Envelope *env= (FMod_Envelope *)fcm->data;
00090     FCM_EnvelopeData *fed;
00091     const float fac= 0.05f * (v2d->cur.xmax - v2d->cur.xmin);
00092     int i;
00093     
00094     /* draw two black lines showing the standard reference levels */
00095     glColor3f(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
00096     setlinestyle(5);
00097     
00098     glBegin(GL_LINES);
00099         glVertex2f(v2d->cur.xmin, env->midval+env->min);
00100         glVertex2f(v2d->cur.xmax, env->midval+env->min);
00101         
00102         glVertex2f(v2d->cur.xmin, env->midval+env->max);
00103         glVertex2f(v2d->cur.xmax, env->midval+env->max);
00104     glEnd(); // GL_LINES
00105     setlinestyle(0);
00106     
00107     /* set size of vertices (non-adjustable for now) */
00108     glPointSize(2.0f);
00109     
00110     // for now, point color is fixed, and is white
00111     glColor3f(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
00112     
00113     /* we use bgl points not standard gl points, to workaround vertex 
00114      * drawing bugs that some drivers have (probably legacy ones only though)
00115      */
00116     bglBegin(GL_POINTS);
00117     for (i=0, fed=env->data; i < env->totvert; i++, fed++) {
00118         /* only draw if visible
00119          *  - min/max here are fixed, not relative
00120          */
00121         if (IN_RANGE(fed->time, (v2d->cur.xmin - fac), (v2d->cur.xmax + fac))) {
00122             glVertex2f(fed->time, fed->min);
00123             glVertex2f(fed->time, fed->max);
00124         }
00125     }
00126     bglEnd(); // GL_POINTS
00127     
00128     glPointSize(1.0f);
00129 }

00136 /* helper func - draw keyframe vertices only for an F-Curve */
00137 static void draw_fcurve_vertices_keyframes (FCurve *fcu, SpaceIpo *UNUSED(sipo), View2D *v2d, short edit, short sel)
00138 {
00139     BezTriple *bezt= fcu->bezt;
00140     const float fac= 0.05f * (v2d->cur.xmax - v2d->cur.xmin);
00141     int i;
00142     
00143     /* we use bgl points not standard gl points, to workaround vertex 
00144      * drawing bugs that some drivers have (probably legacy ones only though)
00145      */
00146     bglBegin(GL_POINTS);
00147     
00148     for (i = 0; i < fcu->totvert; i++, bezt++) {
00149         /* as an optimization step, only draw those in view 
00150          *  - we apply a correction factor to ensure that points don't pop in/out due to slight twitches of view size
00151          */
00152         if (IN_RANGE(bezt->vec[1][0], (v2d->cur.xmin - fac), (v2d->cur.xmax + fac))) {
00153             if (edit) {
00154                 /* 'Keyframe' vertex only, as handle lines and handles have already been drawn
00155                  *  - only draw those with correct selection state for the current drawing color
00156                  *  - 
00157                  */
00158                 if ((bezt->f2 & SELECT) == sel)
00159                     bglVertex3fv(bezt->vec[1]);
00160             }
00161             else {
00162                 /* no check for selection here, as curve is not editable... */
00163                 // XXX perhaps we don't want to even draw points?   maybe add an option for that later
00164                 bglVertex3fv(bezt->vec[1]);
00165             }
00166         }
00167     }
00168     
00169     bglEnd(); // GL_POINTS
00170 }

00172 
00173 /* helper func - draw handle vertex for an F-Curve as a round unfilled circle 
00174  * NOTE: the caller MUST HAVE GL_LINE_SMOOTH & GL_BLEND ENABLED, otherwise, the controls don't 
00175  * have a consistent appearance (due to off-pixel alignments)...
00176  */
00177 static void draw_fcurve_handle_control (float x, float y, float xscale, float yscale, float hsize)
00178 {
00179     static GLuint displist=0;
00180     
00181     /* initialize round circle shape */
00182     if (displist == 0) {
00183         GLUquadricObj *qobj;
00184         
00185         displist= glGenLists(1);
00186         glNewList(displist, GL_COMPILE);
00187         
00188         qobj    = gluNewQuadric(); 
00189         gluQuadricDrawStyle(qobj, GLU_SILHOUETTE); 
00190         gluDisk(qobj, 0,  0.7, 8, 1);
00191         gluDeleteQuadric(qobj);  
00192         
00193         glEndList();
00194     }
00195     
00196     /* adjust view transform before starting */
00197     glTranslatef(x, y, 0.0f);
00198     glScalef(1.0f/xscale*hsize, 1.0f/yscale*hsize, 1.0f);
00199     
00200     /* draw! */
00201     glCallList(displist);
00202     
00203     /* restore view transform */
00204     glScalef(xscale/hsize, yscale/hsize, 1.0);
00205     glTranslatef(-x, -y, 0.0f);
00206 }
00207 
00208 /* helper func - draw handle vertices only for an F-Curve (if it is not protected) */
00209 static void draw_fcurve_vertices_handles (FCurve *fcu, SpaceIpo *sipo, View2D *v2d, short sel, short sel_handle_only)
00210 {
00211     BezTriple *bezt= fcu->bezt;
00212     BezTriple *prevbezt = NULL;
00213     float hsize, xscale, yscale;
00214     int i;
00215     
00216     /* get view settings */
00217     hsize= UI_GetThemeValuef(TH_HANDLE_VERTEX_SIZE);
00218     UI_view2d_getscale(v2d, &xscale, &yscale);
00219     
00220     /* set handle color */
00221     if (sel) UI_ThemeColor(TH_HANDLE_VERTEX_SELECT);
00222     else UI_ThemeColor(TH_HANDLE_VERTEX);
00223     
00224     /* anti-aliased lines for more consistent appearance */
00225     if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glEnable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00226     glEnable(GL_BLEND);
00227     
00228     for (i=0; i < fcu->totvert; i++, prevbezt=bezt, bezt++) {
00229         /* Draw the editmode handles for a bezier curve (others don't have handles) 
00230          * if their selection status matches the selection status we're drawing for
00231          *  - first handle only if previous beztriple was bezier-mode
00232          *  - second handle only if current beztriple is bezier-mode
00233          *
00234          * Also, need to take into account whether the keyframe was selected
00235          * if a Graph Editor option to only show handles of selected keys is on.
00236          */
00237         if ( !sel_handle_only || BEZSELECTED(bezt) ) {
00238             if ( (!prevbezt && (bezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ)) || (prevbezt && (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ)) ) {
00239                 if ((bezt->f1 & SELECT) == sel)/* && v2d->cur.xmin < bezt->vec[0][0] < v2d->cur.xmax)*/
00240                     draw_fcurve_handle_control(bezt->vec[0][0], bezt->vec[0][1], xscale, yscale, hsize);
00241             }
00242             
00243             if (bezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ) {
00244                 if ((bezt->f3 & SELECT) == sel)/* && v2d->cur.xmin < bezt->vec[2][0] < v2d->cur.xmax)*/
00245                     draw_fcurve_handle_control(bezt->vec[2][0], bezt->vec[2][1], xscale, yscale, hsize);
00246             }
00247         }
00248     }
00249     
00250     if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glDisable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00251     glDisable(GL_BLEND);
00252 }
00253 
00254 /* helper func - set color to draw F-Curve data with */
00255 static void set_fcurve_vertex_color (FCurve *fcu, short sel)
00256 {
00257     /* Fade the 'intensity' of the vertices based on the selection of the curves too */
00258     int alphaOffset= (int)((fcurve_display_alpha(fcu) - 1.0f) * 255);
00259     
00260     /* Set color of curve vertex based on state of curve (i.e. 'Edit' Mode) */
00261     if ((fcu->flag & FCURVE_PROTECTED)==0) {
00262         /* Curve's points ARE BEING edited */
00263         if (sel) UI_ThemeColorShadeAlpha(TH_VERTEX_SELECT, 0, alphaOffset); 
00264         else UI_ThemeColorShadeAlpha(TH_VERTEX, 0, alphaOffset);
00265     } 
00266     else {
00267         /* Curve's points CANNOT BE edited */
00268         if (sel) UI_ThemeColorShadeAlpha(TH_TEXT_HI, 0, alphaOffset);
00269         else UI_ThemeColorShadeAlpha(TH_TEXT, 0, alphaOffset);
00270     }
00271 }
00272 
00273 
00274 static void draw_fcurve_vertices (SpaceIpo *sipo, ARegion *ar, FCurve *fcu, short do_handles, short sel_handle_only)
00275 {
00276     View2D *v2d= &ar->v2d;
00277     
00278     /* only draw points if curve is visible 
00279      *  - draw unselected points before selected points as separate passes to minimise color-changing overhead
00280      *     (XXX dunno if this is faster than drawing all in one pass though) 
00281      *     and also to make sure in the case of overlapping points that the selected is always visible
00282      *  - draw handles before keyframes, so that keyframes will overlap handles (keyframes are more important for users)
00283      */
00284     
00285     glPointSize(UI_GetThemeValuef(TH_VERTEX_SIZE));
00286     
00287     /* draw the two handles first (if they're shown, the curve doesn't have just a single keyframe, and the curve is being edited) */
00288     if (do_handles) {
00289         set_fcurve_vertex_color(fcu, 0);
00290         draw_fcurve_vertices_handles(fcu, sipo, v2d, 0, sel_handle_only);
00291         
00292         set_fcurve_vertex_color(fcu, 1);
00293         draw_fcurve_vertices_handles(fcu, sipo, v2d, 1, sel_handle_only);
00294     }
00295         
00296     /* draw keyframes over the handles */
00297     set_fcurve_vertex_color(fcu, 0);
00298     draw_fcurve_vertices_keyframes(fcu, sipo, v2d, !(fcu->flag & FCURVE_PROTECTED), 0);
00299     
00300     set_fcurve_vertex_color(fcu, 1);
00301     draw_fcurve_vertices_keyframes(fcu, sipo, v2d, !(fcu->flag & FCURVE_PROTECTED), 1);
00302     
00303     glPointSize(1.0f);
00304 }
00305 
00306 /* Handles ---------------- */
00307 
00308 static int draw_fcurve_handles_check(SpaceIpo *sipo, FCurve *fcu)
00309 {
00310     /* don't draw handle lines if handles are not to be shown */
00311     if (    (sipo->flag & SIPO_NOHANDLES) || /* handles shouldn't be shown anywhere */
00312             (fcu->flag & FCURVE_PROTECTED) || /* keyframes aren't editable */
00313 #if 0       /* handles can still be selected and handle types set, better draw - campbell */
00314             (fcu->flag & FCURVE_INT_VALUES) || /* editing the handles here will cause weird/incorrect interpolation issues */
00315 #endif
00316             ((fcu->grp) && (fcu->grp->flag & AGRP_PROTECTED)) || /* group that curve belongs to is not editable */
00317             (fcu->totvert <= 1) /* do not show handles if there is only 1 keyframe, otherwise they all clump together in an ugly ball */
00318         ) 
00319     {
00320         return 0;
00321     } 
00322     else {
00323         return 1;
00324     }
00325 }
00326 
00327 /* draw lines for F-Curve handles only (this is only done in EditMode)
00328  * note: draw_fcurve_handles_check must be checked before running this. */
00329 static void draw_fcurve_handles (SpaceIpo *sipo, FCurve *fcu)
00330 {
00331     int sel, b;
00332     
00333     /* a single call to GL_LINES here around these calls should be sufficient to still
00334      * get separate line segments, but which aren't wrapped with GL_LINE_STRIP every time we
00335      * want a single line
00336      */
00337     glBegin(GL_LINES);
00338     
00339     /* slightly hacky, but we want to draw unselected points before selected ones 
00340      * so that selected points are clearly visible
00341      */
00342     for (sel= 0; sel < 2; sel++) {
00343         BezTriple *bezt=fcu->bezt, *prevbezt=NULL;
00344         int basecol= (sel)? TH_HANDLE_SEL_FREE : TH_HANDLE_FREE;
00345         float *fp;
00346         unsigned char col[4];
00347         
00348         for (b= 0; b < fcu->totvert; b++, prevbezt=bezt, bezt++) {
00349             /* if only selected keyframes can get their handles shown, 
00350              * check that keyframe is selected
00351              */
00352             if (sipo->flag & SIPO_SELVHANDLESONLY) {
00353                 if (BEZSELECTED(bezt) == 0)
00354                     continue;
00355             }
00356             
00357             /* draw handle with appropriate set of colors if selection is ok */
00358             if ((bezt->f2 & SELECT)==sel) {
00359                 fp= bezt->vec[0];
00360                 
00361                 /* only draw first handle if previous segment had handles */
00362                 if ((!prevbezt && (bezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ)) || (prevbezt && (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ))) {
00363                     UI_GetThemeColor3ubv(basecol + bezt->h1, col);
00364                     col[3]= fcurve_display_alpha(fcu) * 255;
00365                     glColor4ubv((GLubyte *)col);
00366                     
00367                     glVertex2fv(fp); glVertex2fv(fp+3); 
00368                 }
00369                 
00370                 /* only draw second handle if this segment is bezier */
00371                 if (bezt->ipo == BEZT_IPO_BEZ) {
00372                     UI_GetThemeColor3ubv(basecol + bezt->h2, col);
00373                     col[3]= fcurve_display_alpha(fcu) * 255;
00374                     glColor4ubv((GLubyte *)col);
00375                     
00376                     glVertex2fv(fp+3); glVertex2fv(fp+6); 
00377                 }
00378             }
00379             else {
00380                 /* only draw first handle if previous segment was had handles, and selection is ok */
00381                 if ( ((bezt->f1 & SELECT)==sel) && 
00382                      ( (!prevbezt && (bezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ)) || (prevbezt && (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_BEZ)) ) ) 
00383                 {
00384                     fp= bezt->vec[0];
00385                     UI_GetThemeColor3ubv(basecol + bezt->h1, col);
00386                     col[3]= fcurve_display_alpha(fcu) * 255;
00387                     glColor4ubv((GLubyte *)col);
00388                     
00389                     glVertex2fv(fp); glVertex2fv(fp+3); 
00390                 }
00391                 
00392                 /* only draw second handle if this segment is bezier, and selection is ok */
00393                 if ( ((bezt->f3 & SELECT)==sel) &&
00394                      (bezt->ipo == BEZT_IPO_BEZ) )
00395                 {
00396                     fp= bezt->vec[1];
00397                     UI_GetThemeColor3ubv(basecol + bezt->h2, col);
00398                     col[3]= fcurve_display_alpha(fcu) * 255;
00399                     glColor4ubv((GLubyte *)col);
00400                     
00401                     glVertex2fv(fp); glVertex2fv(fp+3); 
00402                 }
00403             }
00404         }
00405     }
00406     
00407     glEnd(); // GL_LINES 
00408 }

00410 /* Samples ---------------- */
00411 
00412 /* helper func - draw sample-range marker for an F-Curve as a cross 
00413  * NOTE: the caller MUST HAVE GL_LINE_SMOOTH & GL_BLEND ENABLED, otherwise, the controls don't 
00414  * have a consistent appearance (due to off-pixel alignments)...
00415  */
00416 static void draw_fcurve_sample_control (float x, float y, float xscale, float yscale, float hsize)
00417 {
00418     static GLuint displist=0;
00419     
00420     /* initialize X shape */
00421     if (displist == 0) {
00422         displist= glGenLists(1);
00423         glNewList(displist, GL_COMPILE);
00424         
00425         glBegin(GL_LINES);
00426             glVertex2f(-0.7f, -0.7f);
00427             glVertex2f(+0.7f, +0.7f);
00428             
00429             glVertex2f(-0.7f, +0.7f);
00430             glVertex2f(+0.7f, -0.7f);
00431         glEnd(); // GL_LINES
00432         
00433         glEndList();
00434     }
00435     
00436     /* adjust view transform before starting */
00437     glTranslatef(x, y, 0.0f);
00438     glScalef(1.0f/xscale*hsize, 1.0f/yscale*hsize, 1.0f);
00439     
00440     /* draw! */
00441     glCallList(displist);
00442     
00443     /* restore view transform */
00444     glScalef(xscale/hsize, yscale/hsize, 1.0);
00445     glTranslatef(-x, -y, 0.0f);
00446 }
00447 
00448 /* helper func - draw keyframe vertices only for an F-Curve */
00449 static void draw_fcurve_samples (SpaceIpo *sipo, ARegion *ar, FCurve *fcu)
00450 {
00451     FPoint *first, *last;
00452     float hsize, xscale, yscale;
00453     
00454     /* get view settings */
00455     hsize= UI_GetThemeValuef(TH_VERTEX_SIZE);
00456     UI_view2d_getscale(&ar->v2d, &xscale, &yscale);
00457     
00458     /* set vertex color */
00459     if (fcu->flag & (FCURVE_ACTIVE|FCURVE_SELECTED)) UI_ThemeColor(TH_TEXT_HI);
00460     else UI_ThemeColor(TH_TEXT);
00461     
00462     /* get verts */
00463     first= fcu->fpt;
00464     last= (first) ? (first + (fcu->totvert-1)) : (NULL);
00465     
00466     /* draw */
00467     if (first && last) {
00468         /* anti-aliased lines for more consistent appearance */
00469         if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glEnable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00470         glEnable(GL_BLEND);
00471         
00472         draw_fcurve_sample_control(first->vec[0], first->vec[1], xscale, yscale, hsize);
00473         draw_fcurve_sample_control(last->vec[0], last->vec[1], xscale, yscale, hsize);
00474         
00475         glDisable(GL_BLEND);
00476         if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glDisable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00477     }
00478 }
00479 
00480 /* Curve ---------------- */
00481 
00482 /* helper func - just draw the F-Curve by sampling the visible region (for drawing curves with modifiers) */
00483 static void draw_fcurve_curve (bAnimContext *ac, ID *id, FCurve *fcu, View2D *v2d, View2DGrid *grid)
00484 {
00485     ChannelDriver *driver;
00486     float samplefreq, ctime;
00487     float stime, etime;
00488     float unitFac;
00489     float dx, dy;
00490 
00491     /* when opening a blend file on a different sized screen or while dragging the toolbar this can happen
00492      * best just bail out in this case */
00493     UI_view2d_grid_size(grid, &dx, &dy);
00494     if (dx <= 0.0f)
00495         return;
00496 
00497 
00498     /* disable any drivers temporarily */
00499     driver= fcu->driver;
00500     fcu->driver= NULL;
00501     
00502     /* compute unit correction factor */
00503     unitFac= ANIM_unit_mapping_get_factor(ac->scene, id, fcu, 0);
00504     
00505     /* Note about sampling frequency:
00506      *  Ideally, this is chosen such that we have 1-2 pixels = 1 segment
00507      *  which means that our curves can be as smooth as possible. However,
00508      *  this does mean that curves may not be fully accurate (i.e. if they have
00509      *  sudden spikes which happen at the sampling point, we may have problems).
00510      *  Also, this may introduce lower performance on less densely detailed curves,'
00511      *  though it is impossible to predict this from the modifiers!
00512      *
00513      *  If the automatically determined sampling frequency is likely to cause an infinite
00514      *  loop (i.e. too close to 0), then clamp it to a determined "safe" value. The value
00515      *  chosen here is just the coarsest value which still looks reasonable...
00516      */
00517         /* grid->dx represents the number of 'frames' between gridlines, but we divide by U.v2d_min_gridsize to get pixels-steps */
00518         // TODO: perhaps we should have 1.0 frames as upper limit so that curves don't get too distorted?
00519     samplefreq= dx / U.v2d_min_gridsize;
00520     if (samplefreq < 0.00001f) samplefreq= 0.00001f;
00521     
00522     
00523     /* the start/end times are simply the horizontal extents of the 'cur' rect */
00524     stime= v2d->cur.xmin;
00525     etime= v2d->cur.xmax + samplefreq; /* + samplefreq here so that last item gets included... */
00526     
00527     
00528     /* at each sampling interval, add a new vertex 
00529      *  - apply the unit correction factor to the calculated values so that 
00530      *    the displayed values appear correctly in the viewport
00531      */
00532     glBegin(GL_LINE_STRIP);
00533     
00534     for (ctime= stime; ctime <= etime; ctime += samplefreq)
00535         glVertex2f( ctime, evaluate_fcurve(fcu, ctime)*unitFac );
00536     
00537     glEnd();
00538     
00539     /* restore driver */
00540     fcu->driver= driver;
00541 }
00542 
00543 /* helper func - draw a samples-based F-Curve */
00544 static void draw_fcurve_curve_samples (bAnimContext *ac, ID *id, FCurve *fcu, View2D *v2d)
00545 {
00546     FPoint *prevfpt= fcu->fpt;
00547     FPoint *fpt= prevfpt + 1;
00548     float fac, v[2];
00549     int b= fcu->totvert-1;
00550     
00551     glBegin(GL_LINE_STRIP);
00552     
00553     /* apply unit mapping */
00554     ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac->scene, id, fcu, 0);
00555     
00556     /* extrapolate to left? - left-side of view comes before first keyframe? */
00557     if (prevfpt->vec[0] > v2d->cur.xmin) {
00558         v[0]= v2d->cur.xmin;
00559         
00560         /* y-value depends on the interpolation */
00561         if ((fcu->extend==FCURVE_EXTRAPOLATE_CONSTANT) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_INT_VALUES) || (fcu->totvert==1)) {
00562             /* just extend across the first keyframe's value */
00563             v[1]= prevfpt->vec[1];
00564         } 
00565         else {
00566             /* extrapolate linear dosnt use the handle, use the next points center instead */
00567             fac= (prevfpt->vec[0]-fpt->vec[0])/(prevfpt->vec[0]-v[0]);
00568             if (fac) fac= 1.0f/fac;
00569             v[1]= prevfpt->vec[1]-fac*(prevfpt->vec[1]-fpt->vec[1]);
00570         }
00571         
00572         glVertex2fv(v);
00573     }
00574     
00575     /* if only one sample, add it now */
00576     if (fcu->totvert == 1)
00577         glVertex2fv(prevfpt->vec);
00578     
00579     /* loop over samples, drawing segments */
00580     /* draw curve between first and last keyframe (if there are enough to do so) */
00581     while (b--) {
00582         /* Linear interpolation: just add one point (which should add a new line segment) */
00583         glVertex2fv(prevfpt->vec);
00584         
00585         /* get next pointers */
00586         prevfpt= fpt; 
00587         fpt++;
00588         
00589         /* last point? */
00590         if (b == 0)
00591             glVertex2fv(prevfpt->vec);
00592     }
00593     
00594     /* extrapolate to right? (see code for left-extrapolation above too) */
00595     if (prevfpt->vec[0] < v2d->cur.xmax) {
00596         v[0]= v2d->cur.xmax;
00597         
00598         /* y-value depends on the interpolation */
00599         if ((fcu->extend==FCURVE_EXTRAPOLATE_CONSTANT) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_INT_VALUES) || (fcu->totvert==1)) {
00600             /* based on last keyframe's value */
00601             v[1]= prevfpt->vec[1];
00602         } 
00603         else {
00604             /* extrapolate linear dosnt use the handle, use the previous points center instead */
00605             fpt = prevfpt-1;
00606             fac= (prevfpt->vec[0]-fpt->vec[0])/(prevfpt->vec[0]-v[0]);
00607             if (fac) fac= 1.0f/fac;
00608             v[1]= prevfpt->vec[1]-fac*(prevfpt->vec[1]-fpt->vec[1]);
00609         }
00610         
00611         glVertex2fv(v);
00612     }
00613     
00614     /* unapply unit mapping */
00615     ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac->scene, id, fcu, ANIM_UNITCONV_RESTORE);
00616     
00617     glEnd();
00618 }
00619 
00620 /* helper func - draw one repeat of an F-Curve */
00621 static void draw_fcurve_curve_bezts (bAnimContext *ac, ID *id, FCurve *fcu, View2D *v2d)
00622 {
00623     BezTriple *prevbezt= fcu->bezt;
00624     BezTriple *bezt= prevbezt+1;
00625     float v1[2], v2[2], v3[2], v4[2];
00626     float *fp, data[120];
00627     float fac= 0.0f;
00628     int b= fcu->totvert-1;
00629     int resol;
00630     
00631     glBegin(GL_LINE_STRIP);
00632     
00633     /* apply unit mapping */
00634     ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac->scene, id, fcu, 0);
00635     
00636     /* extrapolate to left? */
00637     if (prevbezt->vec[1][0] > v2d->cur.xmin) {
00638         /* left-side of view comes before first keyframe, so need to extend as not cyclic */
00639         v1[0]= v2d->cur.xmin;
00640         
00641         /* y-value depends on the interpolation */
00642         if ((fcu->extend==FCURVE_EXTRAPOLATE_CONSTANT) || (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_CONST) || (fcu->totvert==1)) {
00643             /* just extend across the first keyframe's value */
00644             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00645         } 
00646         else if (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_LIN) {
00647             /* extrapolate linear dosnt use the handle, use the next points center instead */
00648             fac= (prevbezt->vec[1][0]-bezt->vec[1][0])/(prevbezt->vec[1][0]-v1[0]);
00649             if (fac) fac= 1.0f/fac;
00650             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1]-fac*(prevbezt->vec[1][1]-bezt->vec[1][1]);
00651         } 
00652         else {
00653             /* based on angle of handle 1 (relative to keyframe) */
00654             fac= (prevbezt->vec[0][0]-prevbezt->vec[1][0])/(prevbezt->vec[1][0]-v1[0]);
00655             if (fac) fac= 1.0f/fac;
00656             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1]-fac*(prevbezt->vec[0][1]-prevbezt->vec[1][1]);
00657         }
00658         
00659         glVertex2fv(v1);
00660     }
00661     
00662     /* if only one keyframe, add it now */
00663     if (fcu->totvert == 1) {
00664         v1[0]= prevbezt->vec[1][0];
00665         v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00666         glVertex2fv(v1);
00667     }
00668     
00669     /* draw curve between first and last keyframe (if there are enough to do so) */
00670     // TODO: optimize this to not have to calc stuff out of view too?
00671     while (b--) {
00672         if (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_CONST) {
00673             /* Constant-Interpolation: draw segment between previous keyframe and next, but holding same value */
00674             v1[0]= prevbezt->vec[1][0];
00675             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00676             glVertex2fv(v1);
00677             
00678             v1[0]= bezt->vec[1][0];
00679             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00680             glVertex2fv(v1);
00681         }
00682         else if (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_LIN) {
00683             /* Linear interpolation: just add one point (which should add a new line segment) */
00684             v1[0]= prevbezt->vec[1][0];
00685             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00686             glVertex2fv(v1);
00687         }
00688         else {
00689             /* Bezier-Interpolation: draw curve as series of segments between keyframes 
00690              *  - resol determines number of points to sample in between keyframes
00691              */
00692             
00693             /* resol depends on distance between points (not just horizontal) OR is a fixed high res */
00694             // TODO: view scale should factor into this someday too...
00695             if (fcu->driver) 
00696                 resol= 32;
00697             else 
00698                 resol= (int)(5.0f*len_v2v2(bezt->vec[1], prevbezt->vec[1]));
00699             
00700             if (resol < 2) {
00701                 /* only draw one */
00702                 v1[0]= prevbezt->vec[1][0];
00703                 v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00704                 glVertex2fv(v1);
00705             }
00706             else {
00707                 /* clamp resolution to max of 32 */
00708                 // NOTE: higher values will crash
00709                 if (resol > 32) resol= 32;
00710                 
00711                 v1[0]= prevbezt->vec[1][0];
00712                 v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00713                 v2[0]= prevbezt->vec[2][0];
00714                 v2[1]= prevbezt->vec[2][1];
00715                 
00716                 v3[0]= bezt->vec[0][0];
00717                 v3[1]= bezt->vec[0][1];
00718                 v4[0]= bezt->vec[1][0];
00719                 v4[1]= bezt->vec[1][1];
00720                 
00721                 correct_bezpart(v1, v2, v3, v4);
00722                 
00723                 forward_diff_bezier(v1[0], v2[0], v3[0], v4[0], data, resol, sizeof(float)*3);
00724                 forward_diff_bezier(v1[1], v2[1], v3[1], v4[1], data+1, resol, sizeof(float)*3);
00725                 
00726                 for (fp= data; resol; resol--, fp+= 3)
00727                     glVertex2fv(fp);
00728             }
00729         }
00730         
00731         /* get next pointers */
00732         prevbezt= bezt; 
00733         bezt++;
00734         
00735         /* last point? */
00736         if (b == 0) {
00737             v1[0]= prevbezt->vec[1][0];
00738             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00739             glVertex2fv(v1);
00740         }
00741     }
00742     
00743     /* extrapolate to right? (see code for left-extrapolation above too) */
00744     if (prevbezt->vec[1][0] < v2d->cur.xmax) {
00745         v1[0]= v2d->cur.xmax;
00746         
00747         /* y-value depends on the interpolation */
00748         if ((fcu->extend==FCURVE_EXTRAPOLATE_CONSTANT) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_INT_VALUES) || (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_CONST) || (fcu->totvert==1)) {
00749             /* based on last keyframe's value */
00750             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1];
00751         } 
00752         else if (prevbezt->ipo==BEZT_IPO_LIN) {
00753             /* extrapolate linear dosnt use the handle, use the previous points center instead */
00754             bezt = prevbezt-1;
00755             fac= (prevbezt->vec[1][0]-bezt->vec[1][0])/(prevbezt->vec[1][0]-v1[0]);
00756             if (fac) fac= 1.0f/fac;
00757             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1]-fac*(prevbezt->vec[1][1]-bezt->vec[1][1]);
00758         } 
00759         else {
00760             /* based on angle of handle 1 (relative to keyframe) */
00761             fac= (prevbezt->vec[2][0]-prevbezt->vec[1][0])/(prevbezt->vec[1][0]-v1[0]);
00762             if (fac) fac= 1.0f/fac;
00763             v1[1]= prevbezt->vec[1][1]-fac*(prevbezt->vec[2][1]-prevbezt->vec[1][1]);
00764         }
00765         
00766         glVertex2fv(v1);
00767     }
00768     
00769     /* unapply unit mapping */
00770     ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac->scene, id, fcu, ANIM_UNITCONV_RESTORE);
00771     
00772     glEnd();
00773 } 
00774 
00775 /* Public Curve-Drawing API  ---------------- */
00776 
00777 /* Draw the 'ghost' F-Curves (i.e. snapshots of the curve) 
00778  * NOTE: unit mapping has already been applied to the values, so do not try and apply again
00779  */
00780 void graph_draw_ghost_curves (bAnimContext *ac, SpaceIpo *sipo, ARegion *ar)
00781 {
00782     FCurve *fcu;
00783     
00784     /* draw with thick dotted lines */
00785     setlinestyle(10);
00786     glLineWidth(3.0f);
00787     
00788     /* anti-aliased lines for less jagged appearance */
00789     if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glEnable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00790     glEnable(GL_BLEND);
00791     
00792     /* the ghost curves are simply sampled F-Curves stored in sipo->ghostCurves */
00793     for (fcu= sipo->ghostCurves.first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
00794         /* set whatever color the curve has set 
00795          *  - this is set by the function which creates these
00796          *  - draw with a fixed opacity of 2
00797          */
00798         glColor4f(fcu->color[0], fcu->color[1], fcu->color[2], 0.5f);
00799         
00800         /* simply draw the stored samples */
00801         draw_fcurve_curve_samples(ac, NULL, fcu, &ar->v2d);
00802     }
00803     
00804     /* restore settings */
00805     setlinestyle(0);
00806     glLineWidth(1.0f);
00807     
00808     if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glDisable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00809     glDisable(GL_BLEND);
00810 }
00811 
00812 /* This is called twice from space_graph.c -> graph_main_area_draw()
00813  * Unselected then selected F-Curves are drawn so that they do not occlude each other.
00814  */
00815 void graph_draw_curves (bAnimContext *ac, SpaceIpo *sipo, ARegion *ar, View2DGrid *grid, short sel)
00816 {
00817     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
00818     bAnimListElem *ale;
00819     int filter;
00820     
00821     /* build list of curves to draw */
00822     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE|ANIMFILTER_CURVE_VISIBLE);
00823     filter |= ((sel) ? (ANIMFILTER_SEL) : (ANIMFILTER_UNSEL));
00824     ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &anim_data, filter, ac->data, ac->datatype);
00825         
00826     /* for each curve:
00827      *  draw curve, then handle-lines, and finally vertices in this order so that 
00828      *  the data will be layered correctly
00829      */
00830     for (ale=anim_data.first; ale; ale=ale->next) {
00831         FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->key_data;
00832         FModifier *fcm= find_active_fmodifier(&fcu->modifiers);
00833         AnimData *adt= ANIM_nla_mapping_get(ac, ale);
00834         
00835         /* map keyframes for drawing if scaled F-Curve */
00836         if (adt)
00837             ANIM_nla_mapping_apply_fcurve(adt, ale->key_data, 0, 0); 
00838         
00839         /* draw curve:
00840          *  - curve line may be result of one or more destructive modifiers or just the raw data,
00841          *    so we need to check which method should be used
00842          *  - controls from active modifier take precedence over keyframes
00843          *    (XXX! editing tools need to take this into account!)
00844          */
00845          
00846         /* 1) draw curve line */
00847         {
00848             /* set color/drawing style for curve itself */
00849             if ( ((fcu->grp) && (fcu->grp->flag & AGRP_PROTECTED)) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_PROTECTED) ) {
00850                 /* protected curves (non editable) are drawn with dotted lines */
00851                 setlinestyle(2);
00852             }
00853             if ( ((fcu->grp) && (fcu->grp->flag & AGRP_MUTED)) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_MUTED) ) {
00854                 /* muted curves are drawn in a greyish hue */
00855                 // XXX should we have some variations?
00856                 UI_ThemeColorShade(TH_HEADER, 50);
00857             }
00858             else {
00859                 /* set whatever color the curve has set 
00860                  *  - unselected curves draw less opaque to help distinguish the selected ones
00861                  */
00862                 glColor4f(fcu->color[0], fcu->color[1], fcu->color[2], fcurve_display_alpha(fcu));
00863             }
00864             
00865             /* draw active F-Curve thicker than the rest to make it stand out */
00866             if (fcu->flag & FCURVE_ACTIVE) {
00867                 glLineWidth(2.0);
00868             }
00869             
00870             /* anti-aliased lines for less jagged appearance */
00871             if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glEnable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00872             glEnable(GL_BLEND);
00873             
00874             /* draw F-Curve */
00875             if ((fcu->modifiers.first) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_INT_VALUES)) {
00876                 /* draw a curve affected by modifiers or only allowed to have integer values 
00877                  * by sampling it at various small-intervals over the visible region 
00878                  */
00879                 draw_fcurve_curve(ac, ale->id, fcu, &ar->v2d, grid);
00880             }
00881             else if ( ((fcu->bezt) || (fcu->fpt)) && (fcu->totvert) ) { 
00882                 /* just draw curve based on defined data (i.e. no modifiers) */
00883                 if (fcu->bezt)
00884                     draw_fcurve_curve_bezts(ac, ale->id, fcu, &ar->v2d);
00885                 else if (fcu->fpt)
00886                     draw_fcurve_curve_samples(ac, ale->id, fcu, &ar->v2d);
00887             }
00888             
00889             /* restore settings */
00890             setlinestyle(0);
00891             glLineWidth(1.0);
00892             
00893             if ((sipo->flag & SIPO_BEAUTYDRAW_OFF)==0) glDisable(GL_LINE_SMOOTH);
00894             glDisable(GL_BLEND);
00895         }
00896         
00897         /* 2) draw handles and vertices as appropriate based on active 
00898          *  - if the option to only show controls if the F-Curve is selected is enabled, we must obey this
00899          */
00900         if (!(sipo->flag & SIPO_SELCUVERTSONLY) || (fcu->flag & FCURVE_SELECTED)) {
00901             if (fcurve_are_keyframes_usable(fcu) == 0) {
00902                 /* only draw controls if this is the active modifier */
00903                 if ((fcu->flag & FCURVE_ACTIVE) && (fcm)) {
00904                     switch (fcm->type) {
00905                         case FMODIFIER_TYPE_ENVELOPE: /* envelope */
00906                             draw_fcurve_modifier_controls_envelope(fcm, &ar->v2d);
00907                             break;
00908                     }
00909                 }
00910             }
00911             else if ( ((fcu->bezt) || (fcu->fpt)) && (fcu->totvert) ) { 
00912                 /* apply unit mapping */
00913                 ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac->scene, ale->id, fcu, 0);
00914                 
00915                 if (fcu->bezt) {
00916                     int do_handles = draw_fcurve_handles_check(sipo, fcu);
00917                     
00918                     if (do_handles) {
00919                         /* only draw handles/vertices on keyframes */
00920                         glEnable(GL_BLEND);
00921                         draw_fcurve_handles(sipo, fcu);
00922                         glDisable(GL_BLEND);
00923                     }
00924                     
00925                     draw_fcurve_vertices(sipo, ar, fcu, do_handles, (sipo->flag & SIPO_SELVHANDLESONLY));
00926                 }
00927                 else {
00928                     /* samples: only draw two indicators at either end as indicators */
00929                     draw_fcurve_samples(sipo, ar, fcu);
00930                 }
00931                 
00932                 /* unapply unit mapping */
00933                 ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac->scene, ale->id, fcu, ANIM_UNITCONV_RESTORE);
00934             }
00935         }
00936         
00937         /* undo mapping of keyframes for drawing if scaled F-Curve */
00938         if (adt)
00939             ANIM_nla_mapping_apply_fcurve(adt, ale->key_data, 1, 0); 
00940     }
00941     
00942     /* free list of curves */
00943     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
00944 }
00945 
00946 /* ************************************************************************* */
00947 /* Channel List */
00948 
00949 /* left hand part */
00950 void graph_draw_channel_names(bContext *C, bAnimContext *ac, ARegion *ar) 
00951 {
00952     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
00953     bAnimListElem *ale;
00954     int filter;
00955     
00956     View2D *v2d= &ar->v2d;
00957     float y= 0.0f, height;
00958     size_t items;
00959     int i=0;
00960     
00961     /* build list of channels to draw */
00962     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_CHANNELS);
00963     items= ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &anim_data, filter, ac->data, ac->datatype);
00964     
00965     /* Update max-extent of channels here (taking into account scrollers):
00966      *  - this is done to allow the channel list to be scrollable, but must be done here
00967      *    to avoid regenerating the list again and/or also because channels list is drawn first
00968      *  - offset of ACHANNEL_HEIGHT*2 is added to the height of the channels, as first is for 
00969      *    start of list offset, and the second is as a correction for the scrollers.
00970      */
00971     height= (float)((items*ACHANNEL_STEP) + (ACHANNEL_HEIGHT*2));
00972     UI_view2d_totRect_set(v2d, ar->winx, height);
00973     
00974     /* loop through channels, and set up drawing depending on their type  */    
00975     {   /* first pass: just the standard GL-drawing for backdrop + text */
00976         y= (float)ACHANNEL_FIRST;
00977         
00978         for (ale= anim_data.first, i=0; ale; ale= ale->next, i++) {
00979             const float yminc= (float)(y - ACHANNEL_HEIGHT_HALF);
00980             const float ymaxc= (float)(y + ACHANNEL_HEIGHT_HALF);
00981             
00982             /* check if visible */
00983             if ( IN_RANGE(yminc, v2d->cur.ymin, v2d->cur.ymax) ||
00984                  IN_RANGE(ymaxc, v2d->cur.ymin, v2d->cur.ymax) ) 
00985             {
00986                 /* draw all channels using standard channel-drawing API */
00987                 ANIM_channel_draw(ac, ale, yminc, ymaxc);
00988             }
00989             
00990             /* adjust y-position for next one */
00991             y -= ACHANNEL_STEP;
00992         }
00993     }
00994     {   /* second pass: widgets */
00995         uiBlock *block= uiBeginBlock(C, ar, __func__, UI_EMBOSS);
00996         size_t channel_index = 0;
00997         
00998         y= (float)ACHANNEL_FIRST;
00999         
01000         /* set blending again, as may not be set in previous step */
01001         glBlendFunc(GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA);
01002         glEnable(GL_BLEND);
01003         
01004         for (ale= anim_data.first, i=0; ale; ale= ale->next, i++) {
01005             const float yminc= (float)(y - ACHANNEL_HEIGHT_HALF);
01006             const float ymaxc= (float)(y + ACHANNEL_HEIGHT_HALF);
01007             
01008             /* check if visible */
01009             if ( IN_RANGE(yminc, v2d->cur.ymin, v2d->cur.ymax) ||
01010                  IN_RANGE(ymaxc, v2d->cur.ymin, v2d->cur.ymax) ) 
01011             {
01012                 /* draw all channels using standard channel-drawing API */
01013                 ANIM_channel_draw_widgets(C, ac, ale, block, yminc, ymaxc, channel_index);
01014             }
01015             
01016             /* adjust y-position for next one */
01017             y -= ACHANNEL_STEP;
01018             channel_index++;
01019         }
01020         
01021         uiEndBlock(C, block);
01022         uiDrawBlock(C, block);
01023         
01024         glDisable(GL_BLEND);
01025     }
01026     
01027     /* free tempolary channels */
01028     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
01029 }
